page.title: 16Children's Games in Wootton.
page.content: The most popular game among boys was football and among girls netball.Other games mentioned were British Bulldog, Hopscotch and Stoney. To play British Bulldog everybody stands behind a line except for one person.That person calls someone's name and that person has to run over a line on the other side of the playground.If they are tigged they join the catcher in the middle. In Hopscotch a stone is thrown onto a numbered square and the player has to hop up the squares and back, avoiding that square. The stone is then thrown onto the next square along and so on. Stoney is a form of hide-and-seek.If the person who is on sees one of the others she runs to a tree and shouts, "Stoney,one,two,three." The first one seen is on next time.
